text:
One way or another, we’re going to pay for #ClimateChange.
 
We’ve been doing it for decades.
 
Let’s make long overdue investments to accelerate our transition to renewable energy—which will create good-paying jobs, #ActOnClimate, and protect our communities from extreme weather https://t.co/NDOi9NeJLO

If Republican Senators refuse to help, this is the kind of creative idea we need to help protect our kids and get weapons of war off the street.
 
Proud to cosponsor this bill from @RepDonBeyer, which would install a 1000% tax on AR-15-style rifles.
https://t.co/y1Uqw06Oag

This is a critical step toward accelerating our transition to renewable energy, strengthening domestic manufacturing, and lowering energy costs for American families.

I applaud @POTUS for this important action. https://t.co/AZu62xZEVy

TV should reflect the diversity of America so that audiences see a wide array of positive, heartfelt stories of people from all backgrounds.
 
Proud that Kansas City’s own @hallmarkmovie has launched #Mahogany, telling the stories that celebrate love in all its forms.

On the 78th anniversary of #DDay, let us all take time to recognize and give thanks to the heroes who stormed the beaches of Normandy in defense of freedom and democracy.

May we never forget the brave souls who gave their lives to defend the values we cherish today. https://t.co/ytF6YdAssS
Thanks to the #AmericanRescuePlan and #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw, the May Jobs Report outpaced expectations and unemployment remains at a pandemic low. https://t.co/bBk04ZrX6m

I want to say thank you to those in #MO05 for participating in my tele-town hall last night & for engaging in such thoughtful & critical discussion around this pressing matter. 

Many of the concerns voiced closely aligned with the steps @POTUS proposed in last night’s address. https://t.co/WcKmUxhqSl

Research shows that if we still had a federal Assault Weapon Ban, we’d see 70% fewer mass shooting deaths. Thankful to see @POTUS take a firm stance against these weapons of war.
 
The data speaks for itself. Congress must act to protect Americans from what we know is preventable https://t.co/qDnTCCyt7Z

Thoughts and prayers are not enough. 

This moment demands change. As we observe Gun Violence Awareness Day. House Democrats are committed to enacting common sense gun legislation to #EndGunViolence. https://t.co/WNIwca2McZ

I’ll be holding another Tele-Town Hall this evening at 7 pm CT to discuss what Congress and the Administration can do to address gun violence, enact gun safety legislation, and protect communities in #MO05 and across the country.
 
More information here: https://t.co/Wud1Ni8Wqv

The #AmericanRescuePlan provided historic investments to support public health initiatives in states across the country.
 
While I continue fighting for additional investments in public health in Congress, Missouri should allocate more funding to support moms across the state.

Every Missourian deserves peace of mind in knowing they’re getting quality, expert prenatal care. Sadly, nearly 25% of infants in Missouri were born to women receiving less than adequate care.
 
We can, and must, do better.

Missouri currently ranks 44th in the nation in maternal mortality rate—and it’s because our state ranks in the bottom 10% of public health funding per capita, leaving nearly half the counties in our state classified as maternity care deserts.

Yesterday, I hosted a sobering, critically important roundtable discussion on maternal mortality in MO.
 
Thank you to the physicians & individuals from @saintlukeskc, @UHKCMO, @HealthyLivingMO, @NurtureKC, & @MarchofDimes for shedding light on the importance of maternal health. https://t.co/BgK51hgqM0

Wishing everyone in #MO05 and around the world a very happy #PrideMonth2022!
 
As we spend this month celebrating love in all its forms and honoring our LGBTQ+ friends and neighbors, let us also recommit to advancing justice and equality for ALL! https://t.co/xxV1XF52h4
